turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Sir, we're being hailed.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: On screen.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Coordinate our attack with the Valdore's tactical officer. Triangulate fire on any shield impacts.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Captain, the Hemingway has arrived to tow us to spacedock.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: On my way. Please notify Commander Riker.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What's this?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Your new chair, sir.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Diverting to the Kolarin system takes us awfully close to the Romulan Neutral Zone.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Still well on our side...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I think it's worth a look. Don't worry, Number One, we'll get you to Betazed with time to spare.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Thank you, sir...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Where we will all honor the Betazoid traditions. No cold feet, or any other parts of our anatomy. Now, if youll excuse me.  Ill be in the gym.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Captain, I hope I don't have to remind you --

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I appreciate your concern, Number One, but I've been itching to try out the Argo.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Sir --

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Captain's prerogative, Will. There's no foreseeable danger... and your wife would never forgive me if anything happened to you.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Captain, you have an Alpha Priority communication from Starfleet Command.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Acknowledged ...  ...I'll talk to Data.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: We have to assume he had Romulan collaborators.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: A coup d'etat?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: The Praetor's power has always been the Romulan fleet. They must be behind him.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Why don't they answer our hails?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: It's an old psychological strategy, Number One. To put him in a position of dominance and make us uneasy.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: It's working.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Counselor?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Captain, with all due respect to diplomatic protocols  -- the Federation Council's not sitting out here, we are.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Patience. Diplomacy is a very exacting occupation. We can wait.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: She's not out for a pleasure cruise.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: She's a predator.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Not very chatty.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Away team. Transporter room four.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: He wasn't designed to live a complete, human life span.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Can anything be done for him?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Sir?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: His hatred of the Federation is apparent. He would have built a weapon of that scope for one reason. He is going after Earth.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Oh boy. Destroy humanity and the Federation is crippled.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: And the Romulans invade.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Strength in numbers?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We can only hope so.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Report.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: He's firing through his cloak. We can't get a lock.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Counselor Troi, report to the bridge.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Unless we can disable his cloak we're just going to be firing in the dark.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Agreed.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: The Titan's a fine ship, will. And she's getting a captain worthy of her.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: She's the most beautiful ship Ive ever seen.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: But she's not the Enterprise.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I promise you in time, she'll become your home ...If I could offer you one piece of advice?

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Anything.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: When your first officer insists that you can't go on away missions... Ignore him.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: I intend to.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Serving with you has been an honor.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: The honor was mine. Captain Riker.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I hope you'll forgive the darkness... we're not comfortable in the light.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Praetor Shinzon?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: And you're not as we imagined you.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: No?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Praetor?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I've never met a human woman.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I am, Commander Riker...  May I touch your hair?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Praetor, we've come to Romulus on a matter we were -- assured was of great importance. If you have anything to say to us as representatives of the Federation, I suggest you do so now.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: On the world I come from there's no light. No sun. Beauty isn't important. I see now there's a world elsewhere.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Praetor Shinzon. Were not here to discuss your lack of a social life.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Yes, I'm sorry, Captain.  There's so much we have to talk about.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I would be interested to know what we are talking about.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Unity, Captain! Tearing down the walls between us to recognize we are one people. Federation and Romulan. Human and Vulcan and Klingon and Reman. I'm speaking of the thing that makes us the same. We want peace.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I want to end the centuries of mistrust. I want to be your ally, not your enemy. As a first step I propose we eliminate the Neutral Zone and begin a free and open exchange of goods and ideas.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: And the Senate supports you?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I have dissolved the Senate.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Right now, youre thinking this all sounds too good to be true?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: And you're wondering why the Scimitar is so well armed. Is this the ship of a peacemaker? Or a predator?.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: But you're also thinking the chance for peace is too promising to ignore. Above allyou're trying to decide if you can trust me.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Then perhaps the time has come to add some illumination to our discussion. Computer, raise lighting four levels.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: No one knew what to do. Finally I was taken to a doctor who had some experience with Terran illnesses and I was finally diagnosed with Shalaft's syndrome. Do you know of it, Captain?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You know I do.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We need to talk, just you and I.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Come to dinner on Romulus tomorrow. Just the two of us. Or just the one of us.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You know I need to verify this.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: And when I was ready they were going to replace you with me, an exact biological duplicate. Put a Romulan agent at the heart of Starfleet to.influence your command structure. It was a bold plan.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: As happens so frequently here on Romulus, a new government came to power. They decided to abandon the plan -- frankly, I think they were afraid I'd be discovered and it would lead to war. They weren't ready for that.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Romulan ale -- I'm surprised. I can't stand it.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You'll acquire a taste for it.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: It's not quite the face you remember.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Not quite. I envy the hair- line.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: A lifetime of violence will do that. My nose was broken four times. And my jaw... But so much is the same. The eyes, you recognize the eyes.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes. The eyes have it.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Our eyes reflect our lives, don't they? Yours are so confident.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: How did you end up on Remus?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: They sent me there to die. How could a mere human survive the dilithium mines? It was...  I was a slave. And a monster. The only thing the Romulan guards hated more than the Remans was me. But one man took pity on me: the man who became my Viceroy. He taught me how to survive. And in that dark place, where there was nothing of myself, I found my Reman brothers. They showed me the only kindness I ever knew.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: For thousands of years the Romulan Senate has met in this chamber and dictated the fate of its sister-planet... But the time has come for us to live as equals.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You're doing this to liberate the Remans?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: No race should be a slave to another.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: You don't trust me.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I have no reason to.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Of course you do. If you had lived my life and experienced the suffering of my people... youd be sitting where I am now. At least I hope you would.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: And if you had lived my life you would understand that there is a great respons- ibility in representing the Federation. I can't let my personal feelings unduly influence my decisions.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: All I have is my personal feelings.  I wasn't raised with the ideals of the Federation. But I'm trying to understand them now. To live up to them. To live up to you.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I want to know  where I come from. The Remans gave me a future. You can tell me about my past.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: There's so much, and so much of it is dull...

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Were we always explorers?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: No. I was the first Picard to leave Earth.  It caused quite a stir, In fact. But I had spent my whole life...

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Looking up at the stars.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: And you dreamed about what was up there. About...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: New worlds.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: After you, Praetor.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Age before rank, Jean Luc.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: So I'm not as tall as you expected?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I always hoped I would hit two meters.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: With a full head of hair.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: There is that.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Shinzon... I'm trying to believe you.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: If there's one ideal the Federation holds most dear it's that all men, all races, can be united. From the first time the Vulcans came to Earth we've sought a future of peace. Nothing would make me more proud than to take your hand in friend- ship. In time. When trust has been earned.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I'm honored to think I might someday speak with such eloquence.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: In time, Jean Luc.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: In time.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Hello, Jean Luc.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Why am I here?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I was lonely...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I need a sample of your blood. What do your Borg friends say? Resistance is futile.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: All of this so you could capture me?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Don't be so vain. After we found it, we made a few modifications. An extra memory port, a hidden transponder. Perhaps your eyes will be a bit less confident when you learn I've gained access to Starfleet's communications protocols. I now know the location of your entire fleet ...  You may go.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Maybe I'll train it to do little tricks for me like your robot does.  Or maybe Ill snap its ugly head off.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: What's this all about?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: It's about destiny, Picard. About a Reman outcast who...

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You're not Reman.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: And I'm not quite human. So what am I? What do you see?  Do you see a life you might have led? Lost youth never to be recaptured?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I see a young man trying desperately to deny who he is.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I see an old man, set in his ways, afraid to live without a uniform to prop him up and a Starfleet regulation to tell him what to do. I see the man I will never be.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I won't defend my life to you.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: My life is meaningless as long as you're alive. What am I while you exist? A shadow? An enigma?

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: If your issues are with me... This has nothing to do with my ship and nothing to do with the Federation.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Oh, but it does.  We will no longer bow like slaves before anyone. Not the Romulans and not your mighty Federation. We're a race bred for war. For conquest.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Think about what you're doing, Shinzon. Are you ready to plunge the entire quadrant into war to satisfy your own personal demons?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: It amazes me how little you know yourself.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I'm incapable of such an act, and so are you.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I think the facts speak for themselves. The same noble Picard blood runs in our veins. Had you lived my life, you'd be doing exactly as I am. Look in the mirror, and see yourself.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: You can't trace my holographic emitters, Captainn. So don't bother. And you can't contact Starfleet. We're quite alone.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: We are.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: It's just the two of us now, Jean Luc, as it should be... Your ship and mine... You and me.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Why are you here?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: To accept your surrender. I can clearly destroy you at any time. Lower your shields and allow me to transport you to my ship.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: And what of the Enterprise?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I have little interest in your quaint vessel, Captain. If the Enterprise will withdraw to a distance of one hundred light years, it will not be harmed.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You know that's not possible.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I know... you'll all gladly die to save your home world.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Look at me, Shinzon! Do you feel the blood pumping inside you? Your hands, your eyes, your nature, are the same as mine. Buried deep inside you beneath the years of pain and anger is a capacity you've forgotten. It's the one way our mirror can reflect the two of us exactly because it's the very thing that truly defines us. To be human is to try to make yourself better than you are.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I know you as well as I know myself, Shinzon. There was a time you looked at the stars and dreamed of what might be.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Long ago.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Not so long.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Childish dreams, Captain. Lost in the dilithium mines of Remus. I'm what you see now.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I see more than what you are.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: The man who is Jean Luc Picard and Shinzon of Remus won't exterminate the population of an entire planet! He is better than that!

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: He is what his life has made him!

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: So if I gave you my life, what would you do with it? Would you spend the years in a blaze of hatred as you are now? Or could you change? Could you try to remember a mother's touch you never felt? A father's words you never heard? Could you do that?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: But you want to.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: That's your life... not mine.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: Please.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Its too late.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: You can still make a choice! Make the right one now!

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I have no choices! I can't fight what I am!

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I hope you're still alive, Jean Luc.

turns.speaker: PICARD
turns.text: I am.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Don't you think it's time to surrender? I'll have my cloak back in a matter of minutes and your poor ship is shot to pieces. Why should the rest of your crew have to die?

turns.speaker: REMAN OFFICER
turns.text: Praetor, we've received the transponder signal.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: On my way.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Report!

turns.speaker: REMAN OFFICER
turns.text: Two ships decloaking, sir! Romulan!

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Target disruptors. Destroy them.

turns.speaker: REMAN OFFICER
turns.text: Disruptors are off-line, sir.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Deploy the weapon. Kill everything on that ship. Then set a course for Earth.

turns.speaker: REMAN OFFICER
turns.text: What about Picard?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Our greater goal is more important, brother.

turns.speaker: REMAN OFFICER
turns.text: But, Praetor, you won't survive without him...

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Well, that sounds relaxing too.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: It is... invigorating.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: So theyve got him up and running.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: He's a very unusual android.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Runs in the family.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: My God...

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Should I raise shields?

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Minimal damage to the Scimitar.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Defensive pattern Kirk Epsilon. Geordi, get those shields online.

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Believe it or not, I think the cavalry has arrived.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: We're being hailed.

turns.speaker: WORF
turns.text: Intruder alert!

turns.speaker: RIKER
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Are we prepared?

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: Yes, Praetor.

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: This is a mistake.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: He's gentler than I thought. And he has a sense of humor.

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: Don't forget our mission, Shinzon. We should act. Now. Time is running out.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: My time. I'll spend it how I choose.

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: The bond is broken.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Find her again.

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: No -- this is wasting time.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Do as I tell you!

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: It's accelerating. You have no more time for games.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Have the doctors prepare. I'll be on the bridge.'

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: How long?

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: A matter of hours now.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: How long until we reach the Rift?

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: Seven minutes.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Let her pursue -- drop cloak on the aft port quadrant and prepare for full emergency stop.

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: You heard me.

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: Praetor...

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: FULL STOP AND FIRE !

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: What is it?!! Focus on your job!!

turns.speaker: VICEROY
turns.text: She is here.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Join us, Commanders.  Now what's the disposition of the fleet?

turns.speaker: SURAN
turns.text: They're holding position.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: SURAN
turns.text: They will obey, Praetor.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: It's imperative we retain their allegiance or our great mission will be strangled before it can truly draw breath.

turns.speaker: SURAN
turns.text: How many Warbirds will you need?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: None.

turns.speaker: SURAN
turns.text: Praetor. You have the whole fleet at your disposal. They supported the coup, they'll follow you.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: The Scimitar will serve my needs.

turns.speaker: SURAN
turns.text: But surely...

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I came this far alone ...

turns.speaker: SURAN
turns.text: Then I don't understand the reason for the delay!

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: You don't have to understand.

turns.speaker: SURAN
turns.text: And bringing the Enterprise here?! What possible purpose could that serve?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I have a purpose.

turns.speaker: SURAN
turns.text: Then perhaps you will enlight- en us?

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Silence, Romulan!

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: You must learn patience, Commander. Do you know where I learned it? In the dilithium mines of Remus. Spend eighteen hours every day under the ash of a Romulan guards whip and you'll soon understand patience.

turns.speaker: SURAN
turns.text: Praetor.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Now go. I have some personal business.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: The Enterprise is immaterial! They won't make it back to Federation space.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: I thought we discussed patience, Commander.

turns.speaker: SURAN
turns.text: And mine is wearing thin, young man! We supported you because you promised action. And yet you delay and you waste your time playing games with Picard while--

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: Commander Suran, the games are over. In two days the Federation will be crippled beyond repair. Does that satisfy you?

turns.speaker: SURAN
turns.text: For the moment.

turns.speaker: SHINZON
turns.text: And when I return... you and I shall have a little talk about showing proper respect!

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Benny, God, take it easy...

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: I don't want to scare them away.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Right in line with that burning tree.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: I don't see anything.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: It's there. The fog's thicker now, but it's there. What do you think started those fires?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Benny, there's nothing there.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: There is. They came out of the belly of the ship and then went to the first terrace and flew down into the houses.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Flew?! Oh, come on Benny...

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: What did I tell you?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Probably kids.

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: Don't you think you should call a backup?

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: No, we can handle this.

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Mike, call for back-up.  Benny, you all right?

turns.speaker: BENNY
turns.text: I don't think so...

turns.speaker: OFFICER
turns.text: Benny, this is me. I'm going to take a look.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Gate three. It's boarding now.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Have a nice trip.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: What can I do for you folks?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: How much are your rooms?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Thirty-seven fifty for one person, forty-nine fifty for two.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: You have one with two beds?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: I'll take that.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: Fill this out.  Will this be cash or credit card?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Credit card.

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: I'll have to run your card off now.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: We're only going to be here a few hours...

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: It's still the full price.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Do you have a good map of Death Valley?

turns.speaker: CLERK
turns.text: We should have. Let me see.

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: Food. Eat. I prepare food. I work as a cook. That's how I make money.

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: What do you do?

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: I make maps.

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: Hey, that sounds interesting. You like it?

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: Eh... yes.

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: Make any money?

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: You don't get rich as a cook, either, believe me. I got a girl going to college this fall. The wife had to go back to nursing to help pay for it.

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: Do you have children?

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: They're damned expensive and a pain in the ass sometimes, but I wouldn't trade having them for anything.

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: What do you think of America?

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: It is beautiful.

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: Well, here we are... You go down that ramp there, you're sure to get a ride.

turns.speaker: STAR MAN
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: COOK
turns.text: And don't be shy about your English. You speak better than a lot of people I know.  Take care of yourself.

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: No!!! No!!!

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: He's got a gun!!

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Where did you stop last?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: What the hell do you think you're doing?

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Where did you stop last?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Stay right there...

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: What was your last stop?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Elmo's...

turns.speaker: JENNY
turns.text: Where's that?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: About five miles back.

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: We're going... Damn!  We'll tell the press that there was an accident. Chemical warfare spill. That cover cannot be violated in any way. Understand me, Shermin?

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: Major Bell here, sir. We have to tell these people that we're friendly. That this whole thing was a mistake. Is anyone trying to contact the ship?

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: Shermin, I want you and Bell to start looking for the one on the ground.

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: Recognize this?

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: It's a copy of the plaque NASA sent into space on the Pioneer probes.

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: Houston found it in the extraterrestrial's suit.

turns.speaker: MAJOR BELL
turns.text: They must have picked it up in space.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: It's real, George.

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: There's no mistake? You're absolutely sure?

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: I saw it with my own eyes. We've killed an extraterrestrial and...

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: Is there any possibility that it's a hoax? Could you be mistaken?

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: None. And there's another one in the area that's alive. I don't know if it's the only one. I don't know if it was left here by accident or it's part of an inva...

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: Get the body out of there. Load it on the Air Force chopper and get it to Wright Patterson. They'll take it from there... We didn't expect this, Shermin.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Neither did I.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: We'll need a lot of help, George. You could hide an army up here.

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: I'm going to the White House right now. I'll try and get you everything you need.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Wait, wait... What are my orders if we find this thing?

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: Contain it and get back to me.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: What do you mean by 'contain?'

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Then it's not an accident that they found us.

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: We don't think that's necessarily bad. At least it's a point of contact.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Not necessarily bad! If they knew we were here why didn't they let us know they were coming?

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: We'll get those answers when you find the one you're looking for.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: That's not going to happen, George, unless you get us the help you promised us.

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: We've been back and forth on this all day and keeping in mind the panic that would occur if this got to the general public, it's been decided not to expand the search at this time.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Don't let them do it this way, George. It's too important. We can't find this thing alone.

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: You have to. We're trying to contact the ship. If we do, I'll let you know immediately. Good luck.

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: George, we've just confirmed the existence of the live extraterrestrial.

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: When can we expect containment?

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Well, we're in pursuit of a green Mustang...

turns.speaker: FOX
turns.text: It's in a green Mustang?

turns.speaker: SHERMIN
turns.text: Yes. It's kidnapped a woman at gunpoint and from what we can make out is forcing her to drive it somewhere.
